license.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to give official permission for someone to do or produce something, or for an activity to take place
license.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The vaccine has been licensed by the US Food and Drug Administration.
a restaurant which is licensed to sell alcohol
license.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to give official permission for someone to do something or for an activity to take place
license.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The building contractors we hired were licensed by the General Service Administration.
The company is confident that it will be licensed to do business in California after the start of the new year.
license.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to give someone permission to make or produce something to which you hold the patent (=the legal right to make or sell a new product) or copyright (=the legal right to be the only producer or seller of a book, play, film, or record), usually in return for payment
license.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The company has licensed certain manufacturing and marketing rights for the drug.
He has licensed the device to a farm equipment manufacturer.
license.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to receive permission to make or produce something from the person or company that holds the patent or copyright to it, usually in return for payment
license.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: It has licensed electronic publishing rights for the Chinese dictionary from a British publisher.
